ExperimentalFeatures.title: Experimental Features
ExperimentalFeatures.description: Early access to new features. These are experimental and subject to change or removal.

DateTimeFormatSection.title: Date/Time Format
DateTimeFormatSection.description: Configure the format for displaying date and time.
DateTimeFormatSection.showDatesInBrowserLocale: Show dates and times based on the browser locale
DateTimeFormatSection.showDatesInCustomLocale: Show dates and times in a custom format

AccessTokensSection.title: Access Tokens
AccessTokensSection.descriptionline1: An access token is a unique secret key held by a client program so it has permission to use the Galasa service.
AccessTokensSection.descriptionline2: A token has the same access rights as the user who allocated it.
AccessTokensSection.error: Failed to fetch tokens from the Galasa API server

userRole.heading: User Role
userRole.description: The actions a user can or cannot perform on this Galasa service is controlled by their user role.

usersTable.modal_heading: Are you sure you want to delete '{user}'?
usersTable.modal_notificationTitle: Deleting a user will remove any memory the Galasa service has of this user.
usersTable.modal_notificationSubtitle:
Any access tokens previously allocated by this user will be removed and will no longer have access to the Galasa service.

Tests run by this user will remain untouched and available for queries.

If the user logs in to the Galasa service after this point, they will be challenged for credentials from the configured authorization authority, as they were originally when they started using the Galasa service. If that authority allows access, a new set of details for that user will be collected from that point.

TokenResponseModal.description1: Copy the following property into the galasactl.properties file in your Galasa home directory* or set it as an environment variable in your terminal to allow your client tool to access the Galasa Ecosystem.
TokenResponseModal.warningTitle: The personal access token details are not stored and cannot be retrieved when this dialog is closed.
TokenResponseModal.warningSubtitle: Remember to copy the details shown above before closing this dialog.
TokenResponseModal.description2: *If you do not have a galasactl.properties file in your Galasa home directory, run the following command in a terminal to create one:
TokenResponseModal.loadError: Failed to load token response dialog:

TokenRequestModal.token_description: A personal access token is an alternative to using a password for authentication and can be used to allow client tools to access the Galasa Ecosystem on your behalf. Keep your personal access tokens secret and treat them like passwords.
TokenRequestModal.token_name_description: You are about to allocate a new token, please give the token a name
TokenRequestModal.token_name_helper_text: Use this to distinguish between your tokens in the future.
TokenRequestModal.token_name_placeholder: e.g. galasactl access for my Windows machine

TokenDeleteModal.tokensToDeleteCount: Number of access tokens to delete: {count}
TokenDeleteModal.notificationTitle: Client programs using these access tokens will no longer have access to this Galasa Service.
TokenDeleteModal.notificationSubtitle: This operation is irreversible, though new access tokens can be created to replace the ones being deleted. Whichever client program used this token will need to be re-configured to use a replacement.

ProfileDetails.title: User Details
ProfileDetails.lastLoginWeb: Last logged in to this web application (UTC): {date}
ProfileDetails.lastLoginToken: Last logged in using a Galasa personal access token (UTC): {date}

ProfileRole.changeRole: User roles dictate what you can or can't do. Please contact your local Galasa administrator if you need this changed.

AccessDeniedModal.notificationSubtitle: You have access to the Galasa service, but your user role does not have sufficient permissions to perform this operation.
AccessDeniedModal.helpText: If this is a problem, contact your Galasa service administrator and ask to be assigned a role with the required permissions.

ErrorPage.errorDescription: Please report the problem to your Galasa Ecosystem administrator.

Artifacts.title: Artifacts
Artifacts.description: An artifact is a piece of captured state left behind once a Run has completed. Artifacts can also be downloaded and viewed.
Artifacts.select_file: Select a file to display its content
Artifacts.binary_file_message: This is a binary file ({contentType}), please download it to see its content.

LogTab.title: Run Log
LogTab.description: A step-by-step log of what happened over time when the Run was preparing a TestClass for execution, what happened when the TestClass was executed, and when the test environment was cleaned up. The RunLog is an Artifact, which can be downloaded and viewed.

MethodsTab.title: Methods
MethodsTab.subtitle: The list of methods executed during this test run.

OverviewTab.noTags: No tags were associated with this test run.
OverviewTab.recentRunsLink: View recent runs of the same test...
OverviewTab.runRetriesLink: View all attempts of this test run...

TestRunDetails.title: Test Run: {runName}
TestRunDetails.downloadError: Failed to download artifacts. Please try again later.

TestRunsTable.noTestRunsFound: No test runs were found for the selected timeframe
TestRunsTable.limitExceededSubtitle: Your query returned more than {maxRecords} results. Showing the first {maxRecords} records.

timeFrameText.default: Showing test runs submitted in the last 24 hours
timeFrameText.range: Showing test runs submitted between {from} and {to}

TestRunsTable.noColumnsSelected: All of the columns have been hidden in the table design tab, so no result details will be visible. Please adjust the table design to show the columns that you would like to see.

TestRunGraph.noColumnsSelected: All of the columns have been hidden in the table design tab, so no result details will be visible. Please adjust the table design to show the columns that you would like to see.
TestRunGraph.errorLoadingGraph: Something went wrong loading the graph.

limitExceeded.title: Limit Exceeded
limitExceeded.subtitle: Your query returned more than {MAX_RECORDS} results. Showing the first {MAX_RECORDS} records.

timeFrameText.range: Showing test runs submitted between {from} and {to}

content.timeframe: This page is under construction. Currently, all results for the last 24 hours are shown in the Results tab.
content.tableDesign: This page is under construction. In future, you will be able to choose which columns are visible and their order.
content.searchCriteria: This page is under construction. Define specific search criteria to filter the results below.

TestRunPage.notFoundDescription: Unable to find a run with id: {id}

TimeFrame.selectEnvelope: Select the time envelope against which the submission time of each test run will be compared.
TimeFrame.envelopeDescription: Test runs submitted within this envelope will be shown in the results, subject to other filters being applied.
TimeFrame.dateRangeExceeded: Date range cannot exceed {maxMonths} months; 'To' date has been adjusted.
TimeFrame.dateRangeCapped: Date range was capped at the current time.
TimeFrame.invalidTimeText: Please enter a valid time in HH:MM format.

DateTimePicker.invalidTimeText: Please enter a valid time in HH:MM format.

SearchCriteriaContent.description: Edit search criteria to describe the test results you wish to view. Remember to click 'Save' to preserve your changes to the query.

runName.label: Test Run Name
runName.description: Enter the exact name of a specific test run to retrieve.

requestor.label: Requestor
requestor.description: Enter the name of the user who requested the test runs you want to find.

group.label: Group
group.description: Enter the name of a group of test runs to retrieve.

bundle.label: Bundle
bundle.description: Enter the name of the bundle associated with one or more test runs.

submissionId.label: Submission ID
submissionId.description: Enter the ID of a previous test run submission that you wish to retrieve.

testName.label: Test Name
testName.description: Enter the name of a specific test contained within the test runs you want to find.

status.label: Status
status.description: Select a status to find all test runs that have finished with that status.

tags.label: Tags
tags.description: Enter one or more tags associated with the test runs that you wish to retrieve.

result.label: Result
result.description: Select a result to find all test runs currently in that state (e.g., Queued, Finished).

TableDesignContent.description: Customize the test run results view by showing, hiding, and reordering columns.
TableDesignContent.noColumnsSelected: No columns selected – nothing to display. Please select one or more columns.
